author.name: Brother Arnulfus
author.description: A Benedictine monk who doth write devotional poems in Ænglish, praising God and the saints. His poems are often humorous, short, and satirical. They often contain metaphors of alcohol, especially wine or ale.

newsMedieval:
In lands of Cathay strong they rise,
Consumption's vigor in April thrives,
But lo, the factory's contrivance lies,
A sudden contraction strikes our eyes.

To Biden's call for scribes' release,
For Gershkovich and brethren cease,
At White House feast where men did dine,
He spake for liberty, press divine.

Musk, of space his vessel wrought,
A star-bound ship with ambitions taut,
Two billion coin, the cost prepares,
And yet, new funds need not he care.

feedItems.title: China's Consumers Lead Recovery in April
feedItems.description: Retail spending has come back strong, but surveys also showed a surprise contraction in factory activity in April.

feedItems.title: Biden Calls for Release of Jailed Journalist Evan Gershkovich, Other Detainees
feedItems.description: The president addressed the importance of a free press at the annual White House Correspondents’ Association dinner.

feedItems.title: Musk Expects SpaceX to Spend Around $2 Billion on Starship This Year
feedItems.description: The company plans to add more ground infrastructure at its launch site in South Texas and likely won’t need to seek new funding

author.name: Æthelred the Skald
author.description: A Norse poet who doth regale his audience with tales of gods and heroes, praising their might and prowess. He references Norse mythology and history in his poems. He is known for metaphors involving the sea and the weather and weaponry.

newsMedieval:
In skies aloft where Eddas fly,
In haste t'was thought, we place our blame;
Yet oft hath fault a hidden face,
Thine own undoing doth confess.

The cunning numbersmith of yore,
A thorn intwined 'round Wall's brow;
His knowledge vast, his guile reborn,
Resumes as Sjáandi, relentless scorn.

Hark, First Republic's fate belies,
The giants tread the path of war;
San Francisco's keep doth teeter,
Wait they now, to grasp the golden shore.

feedItems.title: More »
feedItems.description: You want to blame the airline, but sometimes it's just your fault

feedItems.title: More »
feedItems.description: He was a hedge fund quant. Now, he's become a thorn in the side of Wall Street.

feedItems.title: What's Going On With First Republic Bank?
feedItems.description: Regulators are poised to seize the San Francisco lender and sell it off to a larger bank.

author.name: Conchobar mac Dubhthach
author.description: An Irish bard of yore, who weaves dulcet melodies that capture hearts with tender love songs. With a quill dipped in courtly love, he pens metaphors of devotion, igniting the flames of passion in every soul who hears his verse.

newsMedieval:
In fair Texas' land, where tumult reigned,
A noise dispute brought sorrow untamed,
Five souls were swept, young and old alike,
In endless search for the miscreant's strike.

Through bearish realms, investors withstand,
Their lessons shared, in uncertain land,
The dance they shift, strategies anew,
For hope in days when skies are less blue.

Harken now, to tales of fortune fore,
Of tech giants when earnings restore,
Though growth is slow, the worst it seems past,
The fires of hope, flicker on steadfast.

feedItems.title: Five People Killed in Texas Shooting; Authorities Searching for Suspect
feedItems.description: A noise dispute may have set off the attack that left an 8-year-old and four adults dead, according to law enforcement.

feedItems.title: Bear Market's Survivors Share Biggest Lessons
feedItems.description: With the S&P 500 in the longest bear market since 1973, individual investors are maneuvering differently from just months ago.

feedItems.title: Big Tech Earnings Spark Hope That Worst Is Over
feedItems.description: Shares rise on better-than-expected results, but growth lags behind what Microsoft, Amazon and Google did in the past.

author.name: Guillemette de Ventadour
author.description: A whimsical troubadour from Occitania, who cherishes the company of nature's gentle creatures. She often includes metaphors of goats, dogs, rabbits, and snails in her poetry. Her writing style is terse.

newsMedieval:
In the fief of circuit'd wares, hope springs anew,
From mighty lords, e'en Amazon to Google grew,
Yet, still the bountiful harvest of the past they lack,
In the kingdom's coffers, slight earnings accrue.

By yonder Sudan's strife, generals' discord doth prey,
As creatures caught in crossfire, shutt'ring homes they lay,
The toll mounts, so does despair, in far corners of that land,
Lives snuffed like gentle candles, in war's malaise they sway.

Yon briny cloaked in toxic cloak, Alberta's weeping shore,
Troubled slumbers of ancient sands disturb'd by avarice's roar,
Exxon's scions now scramble for answers to past mistakes,
While voices of indigenous tribes reach the skies, for justice they implore.

feedItems.title: Big Tech Earnings Spark Hope That Worst Is Over
feedItems.description: Shares rise on better-than-expected results, but growth lags behind what Microsoft, Amazon and Google did in the past.

feedItems.title: What Is Happening in Sudan? The Fighting Explained
feedItems.description: A power struggle between Sudan’s top two generals has left hundreds dead and trapped millions in their homes.

feedItems.title: Exxon's Canadian Affiliate Struggles With Oil Sands Wastewater Leak
feedItems.description: Indigenous groups are criticizing a delay in revealing the full extent of toxic seepage in northern Alberta.
